text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with a product test and a sandwich
recipe and believe it or not I get a lot
of requests hey can you do video on
making sandwiches to which I always
reply you need a video for making
sandwiches come on but it's time to
share so I'm going to show you one of my
all-time favorite sandwiches a grilled
ham cheese and peach preserves panini
now that's alliteration so before we get
to the sandwich let's talk about this a
panini maker now one thing you want to
look for with any kind of panini press
is something that's hinged in the center
that lets it conform to the shape and
the height of your sandwich all right so
that's good the other thing I like no
controls no on no off no hot no low no
medium you just plug it in and you're
ready to roll there's two lights on
there red and green when the green one
turns off it's hot and you're ready to
grill all right to the sandwich you're
gonna take two nice slices of country
bread something delicious
do not use cheap crappy bread for
paninis so go get a nice loaf of bread
Italian French it doesn't matter butter
one side the buttered side is going to
be what touches the surface of the
panini press we're gonna put the butter
side down I'm gonna spread on peach
preserves any kind of fruit jam works
for this but I think peach is a great
combination with the cheddar in the ham
so I'm gonna spread both the non butter
sides with the peach preserves then I'm
gonna lay in some slices of white
cheddar not too much building a sandwich
is like building a pizza all right too
much stuff will actually wreck it you
don't want too much you want enough then
some black forest ham all right once the
hams on a couple slices of cheddar on
top of that then the top piece of bread
gets put down jam side down butter side
up perfect bring that over to the panini
press which is now ready to use because
the green light went off you could do
for regular size or two large sandwiches
on this I'm gonna lay it down there and
I'm gonna press it down and like I said
that hinge in the center is what allows
that top surface to lay down totally
flat on the bread okay
if you're gonna use utensils make sure
they're plastic heat proof or wood don't
scratch your beautiful nonstick surface
here this took me about six minutes for
perfect crispy golden brown all right if
you want to give it a little press a
little pressure as its cooking you'll
get a little flatter maybe slightly
crispier sandwich after five or six
minutes my panini was done it was
magnificent I'm gonna cut it in half so
I can torment you that very subtly
smoked black forest ham the amazing
white cheddar and then that sweet
delicious peach preserve bringing it all
together not to mention the buttery
crusty bread so there you go that is my
recipe for grilled ham cheese and peach
sandwich and also a test for the Musa
panini maker which I'm giving a huge
thumbs up anyway go to the site for the
ingredients there's not really
ingredients you saw the ingredients but
I'll write something under the post you
know to keep in shape and as always
enjoy
you
